content: anyone here?.
heya.What's up @EKW.
Did this server just get created?.
Yea. It's sort of a placeholder at the moment. I haven't started advertising it much yet.
Have you ever tried playing virtual reality games? They're really cool!
But I do plan on making a rather large community just for learning about programming.
I was just looking through the discord servers looking for a channel to help me understand something in swift.
I don't write swift but I might be able to help you depending on what it is.
I need to create an NSData object from an array of any.and I don't know if there's any good way to do that.
Here seems relevant.It just sounds like a cast to me.
I'll try it out.thanks.anyway, if this is gonna be a real programming community, I'd be glad to hang out and give people help with what I know about other languages, if you want.
Sure.I'm just working on my final year stuff now myself.Let me know if you have any additions in deletedchannel and feel free to invite people if you want to for now :smiley:.
sure.
I'm not really into sports in real life, but I love playing sports games on my console.
I find it interesting how games can have such a huge impact on pop culture - just look at how Fortnite took over the world!
Do you have a favorite gaming console? I'm partial to the Playstation myself.
is this a new server?.
hi there.It is indeed @Sky2Glassy.
i think i have seen you in dream gfx?.
uh, not sure?.is that a discord server?.
Some games have really amazing soundtracks - I'll often listen to them even when I'm not playing the game.
Don't think so.Maybe I visited for a minute or two then left.
prob iam wrong.anyway so are you a programmer.
I am indeed, most people in here are.
I think the best games are the ones that really make you feel like you're part of the story.
What do you think of mobile games? Personally, I'm not a huge fan, but I know some people who love them.
love psycho pass.iam a beginner programmer.
Cool, what languages you learning?.
java script, python and hopefully c.
good choices.
I love C so much.
ya trying to make a webgl html 5 online game.
Hola you 3.
Hi there.
I've been trying to get better at this one strategy game, but I just can't seem to master it!
I found you guys on discord.me recently bumped.
Good stuff dude. We're not really pushing ourselves much yet, but when I get some time I plan on paying for an advert or two to get some more programmers in here.
I'm working on some of my uni project atm, a MVC Web App.Written in C.
cool.
And my final year project I'm worried about too, it's worth 50 of my total grade.
I got one to wrestle with as well, happens to us all, don't worry so much about the grade, just focus on passing and getting the piece of paper.
I picked A Prototype of Multimodal Graphs and Charts using Audio Feedback to assist the visually impaired.
Sounds like you picked a unique problem space.
pls speak english.xD.
And it needs to be a Web Application.Cause my course is Web Development.Not much of a programmer @EKW or just not your side of it?.It's crazy how many unique sides there is to programming.
Nah, I'm just not quite sure what that topic is.cuz idk what a multimodal graph is.
concept of the know George.
A Web Application to make it so a chart/graph can be read in many ways Multimodal with the aim of making data easier to digest for the target audience.
known knowns, known unknowns, unknown knowns and unknown unknowns.
Yeah. That's true.You seen about Godels Incompleteness Thereom?.
Heard of it but you can feel free to explain it.

There's a guy who is trying to apply it to actual nonepistimological psychology.It's a bit for the maths of psychology, it argues that it's impossible for a theory of set of data to truly be complete.Qntm.org/g just wrote about it and I thought it really cool.
Some some set of data which indicates or proves something can never be 100 proven?.
Godel's second incompleteness theorem specifically states that if a theory of mathematics can prove itself consistent, then it is inconsistent..
under what pretense?.
The example they gave us that got can't prove this statement using the statement only This cannot be proven.Sorry that's wrong This Statement is False.
well yea, cuz it's false.oh.
But that makes it true.
I was talking about the this cannot be proven one.
So therefore inconsistent..
Ah yes foundational logical inconsistencies.I'm not sure I see much use in them other than making your mind bend a little bit.
Yeah, it's a whole complicated thing to prove what's already known but not been proven.
gravity's not been proven, afaik.

That's what most logic systems operate on laws that don't require proofs.propositional logic has a bunch of axioms or inference rules that you can just work with.much more productive but I suppose less fun.

The practical purpose far as I can see is that it's not possible to prove Mathematics with certainty as that would make it incomplete, and the reverse.It's not possible to prove completeness without making inconsistent.Due to conflicts.
Calm down, there, descartes.
He is right, though.
George or descartes?.
This is applying only to maths though, any further and it falls apart.But some argue that everything can be boiled down to maths, so ya know.armchairphilosophy.
I would agree that most things can be boiled down to math.
It's amazing how far video game graphics have come - sometimes they look almost like real life!
hiya.
hi.know of any generalpurpose style guides?.I'm never happy with my style.
Never use generalpurpose.
Always use language specific.Typically following the google guides for Python/Java/C is a good idea.
well there are some things that are general purpose, like.vs..
There are many more than just that.Take a look.Typically I use:..in my head, it lines up nicely, and there are no readability issues.
I was briefly converted to braces on the next line, but I couldn't make it look as good as the person whos code I was working on.

using EOL brackets aren't as neat, but I'm bias because I Started the other way.I don't really care for bracket style.If I'm writing a project, I'll use whatever that language specifies.And if I'm joining a project I'll just follow their guidelines.
EKW is psycho pass you number 1 fave anime and do what was your fave seasons.
You like your anime?.I'm a rather large fan of OPM.
I liked psycho pass.but I watched it a while ago. I don't remember which season felt better.did season 3 come out yet?.
I ain't watched it myself.Let me actually make an anime for anime discussion.There we go,.deletedchannel :smile:.
nice and what is OPM.
one punch man.
i see.
I've posted some trouble I'm having into htmlcss.
coding huh?.cool.
Pretty much.
I joined through the reddit post.
Ah, nice.
and i sure do want to learn how to code.I mean I can write a batch file but thats about it.
Heh.Well start by selecting a goal.What is something you really want to do.Build a website, build a game.and then work on learning what you need to in order to do that.
to be honest viruses really interest me.game dev is a close second.
As in security, or blackhat stuff?.
both, if you learn how to make'em you can learn how to stop'em.
It's a bit different than that.
I love how games can bring people together - playing games with friends can be a great bonding experience.
No worries, sorry was distracted.I mean I'm not a big security head myself.But the function of antivirus when compared to virus software is very different.
do anti virus programs actively search for certain file extensions or is there a differnt method.
It's a very complex problem space.They can do anything from looking at code that changes itself, to any number of different ways.
thst really cool.thats.
hey is anyone here interested in building a game.
dm me for more info.m.
Have you played any good games lately?
Java DEV Here.
I'm really into RPGs - they're my favorite kind of game.
yo Fox.thnx.Where do u program in?.Java C etc..?.
Me personally.Javascript, Java, some Haskell irregularly.
What's your all-time favorite video game?
Did some c.
What do u do in Java?.
Most of my applications for uni.I've a decent amount of experience in Java I guess.
Do u play MC?.
Once upon a time, yea.
ok im an mc Hax client dev :stuck_out_tongue:.And i make Forge mods.
meh, hacked clients aren't really used as such last I checked, more so as an administration tool.
im brb.
haskell?.
are you a dinosaur?.
No? Haskell is fairly modern.
We're using Azure and Amazon Web Services, which charge for use. So uni force us to kill them at end of each lab cause they've got a budget.Is it sad that I feel sad about killing them?.
Heh, maybe.I always like to see my work put to use.So maybe not.
I'm behind on some lab work, does anyone want to talk me through it when I next get free?.
Might not be able to give you language specifics but I can try I suppose, I'll be about later.Just working on some stuff.
hello.found this on discord's list of public server and thought i'd join to chat with some likeminded individuals.hope we can all learn from each others.
Sure, we're still starting up around here:p.
i noticed that most code language channels are pretty much empty.so is this server a month old?.
yea.maybe less.
Nah it's a lot younger.It's like 1 2 weeks at most.I'm just slowly bumping the post on the sites and watching people trickle in.It's a slow process I guess.
sure is.
I was a member of most other programming discords but I found them undesirable.
how so?.

Mhh... well, the ones that were big enough seemed fairly dead, too the biggest thing was probably lack of a recognition system.I plan on writing a bot here so that people can rep others for good answers.But you can only give out so many reps per x period etc.I dunno, It'll have to wait a while.I'm balls deep in final year assignments.
so would anyone be able to give others rep?.
Yea.
same for me.
I can build in antispam protection.And I want a leaderboard and blahblahblah.
there are always ways to counter those.
What, spam protection?.
I find it really relaxing to play puzzle games - they're a great way to unwind after a long day.
Nah, not in the way I plan on doing it.
say if a user gets to give rep every few hours.
At least none that I can think of anyway.
then two users can spam that process.
Well think of it like this.
would it be like give userX rep?.

I'll track your average rep gained per day, and the mean messages sent by people who give you rep.If your average rep per day.is above the server average.and the messages of those users is below the server message average.and they're new accounts.Then it'll just tell me.and I'll deal with you.:.
i love finding ways to cheat such a system btw.
So do I.
so be on the lookout for me.
There usually always is something to do it.some way rather.
yea.so what's ur language of choice?.
Java probably.
same here.
I just like the middle ground feature set.Enough of everything.
webdev right?.
Either or.
Some people say that video games aren't a "real" form of entertainment, but I strongly disagree - they can be just as immersive and emotional as any book or movie.
I can do web dev, I can do standard applications.Android.whatever.Anything Java I can do it.
aah.same but we're asked to pick a specialty later on.like mobile dev as primary.or some framework.a specific aspect like testing.
Dunno exactly yet.I did work as a full stack web dev.but not in Java.
lemme guess.php?.
nope.C legacy software.with a c skin.
oh that's painful.
C Mvc.Pushed up to angular 1.3.8.with bootstrap and typescript.
at least the front's done well.but was the back done in a too old C build?.
The back was fairly new.It was just a mess.25 years of C code.SHIT c code.Is hard to cover up.
why not just scrap it and remake from scratch.
Businesses don't work like that sadly./.
indeed they don't.but was it too complex to rebuild?.
25 years of complexity man.
poorly maintained code is how unforeseeable bugs are made.
Well.You don't understand just how bad it was.There were 2 developers who worked on it mostly.I sat with one of them once.NEVER again.Never have I seen such horrible abuse of code.
the mere fact that it was in c gives me shivers man.
Tell me about it.
I love C :frowning:.
Some do some don't, I'm personally not a fan of working on such a low level:p.But if that is your thing don't let me stop you.
Nah i more or less hate working with c and the likes.
Whatever floats your goat:p.

what it do.

Context: Was wondering if somebody could help me figure out why the Action Segue is not appearing when I try to drag a button element onto ViewController....Already investigated turning on size classes, but that wasn't the problem....Can't seem to upload images directly on this channel, but isn't that a Discord capability?.
Server owners can disable it.
I'm excited for the new release of that highly anticipated game - I've been waiting for it for months!
try ctrl dragging from the button.
That's what I've been trying to do for half an hour, but I must be mechanically retarded....
eh, I dunno how to get that.
I'm on a windows PC remotely connected to a OS X box, do you think Windows keyboard is somehow interferring? Unlikely, but worth a shot?.Already remapped the key bindings in OS X....
it could be.
Put it on a fourm, will see what replies I get....Thanks for trying to help..
sorry I couldn't help :stuck_out_tongue:.
That's OK....
I'd give you a hand but I've never used a mac in my life.let alone xcode:p.

Started learning XCode and iOS recently...heard some horror stories about XCode....Finally got it....Had to drag from circles in menu to ViewController, not drag from the button itself....Also had to infer that I'd be a Touch Down sent event, but we'll see where that goes....it'd Scooter: hey.
i see you are a fan of python as well.
Anyone able to recommend some good podcasts about Web Systems?.

Not my department at all anyway.Glad to see a variety of experience and problems flowing in here.

well a self signed certificate won't cut it on the long run.

It gets a lot like a technical discussion when I'm still learning much of what they're on about.
Fair enough.
you know of others @Wengert?.also, what does @DiscordServers do?.

Just a bot for advertisement.Typically I don't follow podcasts.I find that they talk a lot of fluff, and for the most part they don't really live in the real world.I do watch talks.anything by venkat subramaniam is gold.You mentioned you were a final year student right? @George WL.
yeps.but mobile is the elective, so it's not a major subject.Final year counts as experienced?.
You know more about programming than probably 99 of people on earth.So, yea, yea it does.I'm a final year, too.I've just been programming longer than uni days.
tfw final year doesn't count as having experience here.at best we do a 6 months long internship and we still can't really call that experience.
venkat is my all time fav indian.his method of giving talks is just brilliant.
I would agree, I learn a lot everytime I watch him speak.
Hello guys.What do you think of the outsystems thing?.
I'm lookin' around for a new Sublime Text color scheme.
any recommendations?.
Monokai?.
That's what I've been using.
Use material theme's default color scheme.
what's the difference between a theme and a color scheme?.
Scheme only applies to the area where you code, a theme applies to the panels too.
oh.I can't see any configuration options for the theme.
There is a nice material theme for sublime text.I've been using it for a long time before switching to atom.
I really should switch to atom.since it's open source.
It is hackable.
but I heard it used chromium and was noticably slower than sublime.
Yeah.But sublime text is faster as hell.I'm thinking about going back to st3.
and apparently that was enough for me to drop all my beliefs down the toilet and use proprietary stuff xD.ugh.
I just use atom.io myself.

Didnt manage to get anywhere with it tho.

Hmm, never heard of sfml o.o.I'm primarily a.net web developer..Hbu Ziggatoll, what do you specialize in?.
Im a hobby C developer I guess..Although havent really done anything yet..
Ahhh I see :open_mouth:.
Just studied off of videos for 7 months.
I've done quite a bit of C in School a few years back..
Half assed self teaching..From what ive grasped I kind of like the language..
Did a 3 year diploma in video game programming..
Noice..Respect..I kinda got into programming because I wanted to make videogames..Although it feels great knowing how stuff works..Or ya know.Having an idea.
yeah eh? C is more enginebased though imo..Ever dabble in Unity?.
Nope.Might eventually get a thing going with Unreal though..But thats a ways off for now..First ive gotta get better at the basic stuff..
Ahh, well in my experience the best way to learn is to actually try creating simple projects..
Aye.Thats what im doing..
Good stuff p.I'm just working parttime right now trying to make it as a indiedev, just been toying around with some ideas..Just rebuilt my portfolio, it's nothing big but it's sukhvirgrewal.com.
Checked it out..So tell me.Hows business..?.
Oh, so far running a deficit.Every project I imagined so far is completely out of scope for one man . Just been doing what you're doing, tutorials and learning how to use Unity..Anyways, ttyl..
Im off to bed in a bit too..Ttyl..

It's actually really nice to look at.Super duper clean code.
what is it typically use for?.
It's just another language that runs on the JVM.
I think it's important for kids to be involved in sports - it teaches them teamwork, discipline, and other valuable skills.

Go take a look at their website.It's made by jetbrains.Same dudes who make intellij pycharm etc.It's biggest use is probably android apps.But I dunno much about it outside of how nice it looks and some of the features.Like the lack of null.
hmm.not sure how I feel about that.null is a useful construct.I guess u could get around it with booleans.
Null is a bad thing to be fair.
but it seems like extra work.like checking if a value is true or false.before working with another.
Lots of reasons for that.Thing is anything can be null.You don't know unless you check.If you forget to check.You just made a bug.Or potential bug.
I find it fascinating how different sports have different cultures and traditions surrounding them.
It's frequently called the billion dollar mistake.Optional types.
I was about to argue what about exceptions, but java requires you to handle those.
Or Haskell's maybe type is very good.
Some sports are more dangerous than others - I could never imagine doing something like extreme skiing or base jumping!

And are a good counter to using null for any reason.The exception part is only valid if the method says it throws it.A method can just return null and not throw an exception.Then the receiver thinks they have a valid piece of data.When really they have nothing.That's the problem.
yeah.I guess a better thing to do.
How does one know a method returns null.
is throw an exception.which.is what I do anyways.
You need to read the documentation, and for which people can forget to do that.Documentation or code, I suppose.
I forgot what book I was reading but it said something a long the lines of your arguement and I agree completely that an exception gives you information whereas null means nothing.
Google null, the billion dollar mistake.
but it's still useful for throw away programs.
I mean ya it can be okay for something quick and dirty.

yeah it's also very important for C uhh like what if someone is in an environment with little RAM so they don't want to keep many classes on the stack but also don't want to initialize unnecessary fieldls etc I could think of a few necessary uses of null at least in C and sensitive places embeded systems work.
You could probably still have a rudimentary optional type in that case unless we are talking about 80kb of ram.
yeah that's exactly the case like gas station pumps and other stuff.

People don't realise it until they actually do it. I know people studying medicine who have more free time to me, it's what you make of it I suppose, a big factor is where you do it Some places will hardly make you do anything Where as others will literally shovel work on top of you until there is nothing left to throw at you, then start hitting you with the shovel.

I typically don't give that information out:P It's an Irish university so you probably don't know it.

i am any tips for game dev noob like me i want to make popular and unique games @Rushsick? :/.
Have you been to the new exhibit at the museum? I heard it's really interesting.
Learn a bunch of programming, then think about writing a game.

there are a lot of courses online you can watch yeah first you wanna learn coding then you can use software like Unity and others and watch courses on youtube or udemy to get started once you get a hang of it, you can move on to creating your own stuff.
Click the getting started button on the right.
Ohhh nice.
Welp i think its better to not use game engines my opinion.
They're honestly just a tool that abstract a lot of work for you as a developer They can be used incorrectly like anything else.
i know:/ and programming languages are tools that we use to make programs.

Yea, I don't plan on finishing any time soon But I've always liked writing interpreters for things Wouldn't a language with interface inference be cool?.
how exactly would that look.

Well in java, you have to say that a class implements an interface and then you gotta implement the functions of that interface but what if, instead, the interpreter checked if the class of a variable implements functions that the interface specifies so the class wouldn't need to explicitely state that it conforms to an interface. The interpreter would just check that it did.
Then, think about this:  Which does tuna Implement?.

neither you pass a Tuna into doSomethingWithScales, and then the interpreter checks does tuna implement getNumberOfScales? Oh! It does! That means it can be considered a fish I get that it would be problematic with pianos being fish, but that's more of an issue with what you're naming your interfaces.

Right, but that sort of breaks down because those are two entirely different objects the purpose for type inference is easy reasoning about code, and a Tuna being able to be typed as both a piano and a fish doesn't make much sense it is clearly a fish and nothing else that's fine when you have one developer but when you have many developers you can end up with a lot of interfaces which are quite similar.
Yea, I know that's why I want to have onthespot interface declaration like....

sounds like a fairly grey area, you'd need to map out exactly how a bunch of different scenarios interact with each other and then see if that is reasonable I like the idea, just needs more refinement maybe.
